results.title: Red light in full flight
results.creator_credit: Samia Mikhail, Sharyn Prentice and Flamingo Star Films
results.brief_description: The culture of Middle eastern belly dancing in Australia is a prolific one, with belly dancers in Australia outnumbering dancers in other countries. The director gleans anecdotes about the history of this sensual womens’ dance and interviews Australian dancers about their dance, their lives and their culture. It also discusses the importance of traditional cultural dance in women’s lives.

results.title: Red heat (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Gordon Carroll and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Russia’s deadliest drug smuggler has gone to Chicago to gain dominance of the drug market in the United States. Moscow’s most disciplined police officer is sent over to hunt him down, working in collaboration with a wise-cracking U.S. detective who follows his own rules. Starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and James Belushi, “Red Heat” is a well-crafted mix of humour and action with some deftly executed stunt sequences.

results.title: Red ensign
results.creator_credit: Michael Powell, Jerome Jackson and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: This is the story of David Barr, a shipbuilder, who fights to keep the shipyards open during the Depression of the 1930’s. David Barr fights the cautious businessman, Lord Dean, both for the affection of the heiress, June MacKinnon, and for the use of her money to finance his construction program. Stars Leslie Banks, Carol Goodner, Alfred Drayton, Frank Vosper.

results.title: For gentlemen only
results.creator_credit: Michael Scott, Vladmir Valenta, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of two retired old men whose comfortable world is threatened when their hotel, formerly for gentlemen only, decides to admit women. The film shows how they react to and cope with this change. (Award: Toronto)

results.title: Red Beard = Akahige
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: The last collaboration between actor Toshiro Mifune and Kurosawa, is a moral tale about a young and arrogant medical graduate - charged by his modern training and ambition - who is devastated to be assigned to an impoverished local clinic. The young doctor’s mentor, Red Beard, aims to show the young gun that there is more to life than prestige and power and more to healing than medicine. Set in 1820, this is a poignant and compassionate work; a humanistic narrative that follows the character’s arc from supercilious to empathetic whilst presenting a myriad of stories about the villagers and their struggles.

results.title: For all practical purposes. On size and shape. 3
results.creator_credit: Olga Rakich, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP
results.brief_description: It grows and grows explores the mathematical concept of geometric growth, by looking at compound interest, and how to calculate the maximum sustainable yield of fish. The program discusses limiting values, reproduction curves, population pyramids and explains the formulae used for calculating these.

results.title: For a lost soldier = Voor een verloren soldaat
results.creator_credit: Roeland Kerbosch, Matthijs van Heijningen and Sigma Film Productions
results.brief_description: Forty years after the fact, choreographer Jeroen Boman (Jeroen Krabbe), recalls his childhood experiences as an adolescent in wartime Holland. Evacuated from Amsterdam to a country village, young Jeroen (Maarten Smit) is troubled by the isolation from his family and the sexual curiosity of the girls and boys around him. Once the Allied Forces move into the village, Jeroen enters into a tender relationship with Canadian soldier, Walt (Andrew Kelley). Never stooping to sensationalism, this gay ‘coming of age’ film is delicately handled and beautifully written. From the novel by Rudi Van Dantzig. In Dutch with English subtitles.

results.title: Frog army!
results.material_description: Digital screen recording of @thinfrog's tiktok feed
results.brief_description: For 40 days, @thinfrog posted videos showing frog spawn being gathered from various waterways and placed in his backyard pond to create a ‘frog army’, which soon took over his and his neighbours’ gardens. Four million views followed, some revelling in the squelchy horror, others outraged by his ego tripping, plague fantasies and environmental irresponsibility. However others noted that the footage had been sourced from a variety of existing docos and news stories: a hoax of biblical proportions.

results.title: Footrot Flats - the Dogs Tail Tale
results.creator_credit: Murray Bell, Paul Cox and John Barnett
results.brief_description: This is the dog’s tale: his first encounter with the sexy bitch Jess; his loyal devotion to Wal Footrot, whom he saves from a fate worse than death; his adventures with Horse, the cat with the barracuda jaw and fishhook claws; his brilliant cowardice and mighty nose, pitted against the dastardly schemes of the villainous Murphys, their hell hounds, and the croco pigs. Based on the comic strip of the same name.

results.title: Kalihgat
results.creator_credit: Terry Melvin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Terry Melvin recalls a cathartic event from his youth, when he travelled as a university student to India. In Calcutta, he worked in a hospice for the dying and destitute and tells of the experiences that have shaped and haunted the person his is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Melvin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
